newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada dollar closes weaker in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Canada dollar closes weaker in thin trade.

text.p: * Canada's dollar weakened to C$1.3705 (US$0.7293) from Friday's opening bid of C$1.3700 (US$0.7299) in quiet trading heading into a holiday weekend in London, dealers said.
* They said the currency faced slight pressure from fixed income sales after a cut in interest rates on Thursday.
* The unit is expected to strengthen next week.
But the weakness is probably only temporary, said Gregory.
"We're still closing the week on a firmer tone."

In economic news on Friday, Statistics Canada said the country's wholesale trade rose 0.3 percent seasonally adjusted in June to C$2.14 billion, falling short of a Reuters survey of economists which had forecast a 0.8 percent month-on-month rise in June.
On the crosses, Canada's dollar fell to 1.0779 marks from Thursday's close of 1.0900 marks and slid to 78.84 yen from Thursday's close of 79.09 yen.
